imrotate2

PURPOSE

Custom version of imrotate that demonstrates use of apply_homography.

SYNOPSIS

function IR = imrotate2( I, angle, method, bbox )

DESCRIPTION 

 Custom version of imrotate that demonstrates use of apply_homography.

 Works exactly the same as imrotate.  For usage see imrotate.

 USAGE
  IR = imrotate2( I, angle, [method], [bbox] )

 INPUTS
  I       - 2D image [converted to double]
  angle   - angle to rotate in degrees
  method  - ['linear'] 'nearest', 'linear', 'spline', 'cubic'
  bbox    - ['loose'] 'loose' or 'crop'

 OUTPUTS
  IR      - rotated image

 EXAMPLE
  load trees;
  tic; X1 = imrotate( X, 55, 'bicubic' ); toc,
  tic; X2 = imrotate2( X, 55, 'bicubic' ); toc
  clf;  subplot(2,2,1); im(X); subplot(2,2,2); im(X1-X2);
  subplot(2,2,3); im(X1); subplot(2,2,4); im(X2);

 See also IMROTATE

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
  • apply_homography Applies the homography defined by H on the image I.
This function is called by:

0029 
0030 function IR = imrotate2( I, angle, method, bbox )
0031 
0032 if( ~isa( I, 'double' ) ); I = double(I); end
0033 if( nargin<3 || isempty(method)); method='linear'; end
0034 if( nargin<4 || isempty(bbox) ); bbox='loose'; end
0035 if( strcmp(method,'bilinear') || strcmp(method,'lin')); method='linear';end
0036 
0037 % convert arguments for apply_homography
0038 angle_rads = angle /180 * pi;
0039 R = rotationMatrix( angle_rads );
0040 H = [R [0;0]; 0 0 1];
0041 IR = apply_homography( I, H, method, bbox );
